The notion of a flat Earth has its roots in ancient cultures, with some societies

believing that the Earth was a flat disc or plate surrounded by a firmament (a

solid dome) above which the sky existed. However, with the advent of modern

science and technology, particularly during the 16th century, the concept of a

spherical Earth became widely accepted (NASA: The Shape of the Earth).
